availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: "Bravo, Paris Exposition!" was published in Harper's Weekly 33, 28 September 1889. It was reprinted in Good-Bye My Fancy (1891) and in Leaves of Grass (1891â€“1892). According to a letter from Whitman to R. M. Bucke, this poem was also reprinted in the French paper "Le Temps." This proof has been pasted down to a backing sheet, rendering the verso inaccessible.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Bravo, Paris Exposition!
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman Literary Manuscripts in the Walt Whitman Collection, Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center at the University of Texas at Austin
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

The prose drafted on the back of these and several other related manuscript leaves includes ideas and phrases that resemble those used in "Unnamed Lands," a poem published first in the 1860 edition of Leaves of Grass.

lg.head: BRAVO, PARIS EXHIBITION!Exposition!
lg.l: Add to your show, dearbefore you close it, France,

With all the rest, visible, concrete, temples, towers, goods, ma–
chinesmachines
and ores

Our sentiment wafted from many million heart–throbs, ethereal
but solid,

(We grand–sons and great–grand–sons do not forget your grand–
siresgrandsires
,)

From fifty Nations and nebulous Nations, compacted, sent
over–sea to–day,
America's applause, love., memories and good–will.
